location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Captain Charles William Burton, Bickaneer [Bīkāner] to Colonel Lewis Pelly

physicalDescription.extent: Conservation: The letter was originally tied together with pink wool which was removed to enable the letter to be read fully, and the letter placed in an acid-free paper folder instead. The wool tie was placed at the rear of the folder in a plastic sleeve.

mods.abstract: Letter detailing the complaints of the Fharhoors? against the Chief of Bickaneer (Dungar Singh), including:difficulties for local Chief's in handling complaints relation to the practices of their predecessorsthe current Maharaja and difficulties with himproblems with the collecting and levying of revenuesthe oppressive conducts of certain individuals who dispose of cases based on their own ideas of justicethe jealousy and animosity caused by the elevated position of Lal Singhthe mistreatment of the son of a former ruleranimosities from appointments of certain individuals to high positionsthe influence of the Baid familyattempts to estrange the Maharajah from British Officers
